content:
advertisement

Members of Kappa Alpha Order fraternity  E PERIOD Beaver Ave. plan to plead not guilty to charges of furnishing alcohol to minors and will request a jury trial at their formal arraignment Feb PERIOD  PERIOD

 said Joseph Chiodo former president of Kappa Alpha PERIOD Chiodo was the fraternitys president when the incident occurred July  PERIOD

The fraternity waived its right to a preliminary hearing last Wednesday at Centre County Courthouse in Bellefonte on the advice of their lawyer Chiodo said PERIOD A jury trial is planned for early March he said PERIOD

According to court documents the fraternity was officially charged on Dec PERIOD  with furnishing alcohol to minors as a result of a July  incident at the house PERIOD

Police documents say the State College Police Department responded to a fight in the front yard of the fraternity house in which 17yearold Ammon Ali allegedly stabbed two members of Kappa Alpha Order and a member of Sigma Alpha Mu fraternity  E PERIOD Prospect Ave PERIOD

Police monitored the house for more than two hours and arrested Ali a State College resident when he attempted to leave the fraternity PERIOD

Police said they observed a large party and empty beer cans scattered throughout the fraternity house PERIOD

Another 17yearold involved in the altercation told police members of the fraternity had given him beer inside the house PERIOD Two other individuals under  also told police they had been served beer inside the fraternity house PERIOD

Ali was charged with two counts of aggravated assault three counts of simple assault and one count each of recklessly endangering another person making terrorist threats and harassment PERIOD The outcome of Alis criminal proceedings cannot be released because he is a juvenile PERIOD

Court documents do not indicate the alcohol charges and Alis criminal charges are related PERIOD

Although Centre County officials did not officially file charges until Dec PERIOD  the Interfraternity Council IFC sanctions were implemented and completed by the end of the fall semester IFC President Andy Hackett said PERIOD Kappa Alpha never had an official trial with the IFC PERIOD
